job_description:
Technical Project Manager (Senior)

Company: Tranzmeo

Location: Kochi (Infopark) — with periodic travel to field sites and to US office (Houston) as required.

Employment Type: Full-time, senior individual contributor / people-lead depending on candidate profile.

Tranzmeo is seeking a Senior Technical Project Manager with 10+ years of experience to lead cross-functional engineering programs for its AI + fibre-optic sensing products. This role requires deep technical leadership (strong hands-on development experience with Python and front-end technologies preferred), program management, and domain coordination across product, hardware, cloud, and field operations teams. The ideal candidate will translate product vision into delivery plans, remove technical blockers, and drive high-quality releases for industrial, mission-critical environments.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Program Leadership & Delivery

  • Own end-to-end delivery of one or more product modules (e.g., T-Connect OneView features, STS enhancements, uptime monitoring).
  • Create and maintain product roadmaps, release plans, milestones, risk logs, and cross-team dependency maps.
  • Run agile ceremonies, sprint planning, PI planning, and retrospectives; ensure a predictable cadence.

2. Technical Leadership & Hands-on Involvement

  • Leverage prior development experience (Python + front-end) to review architecture, contribute to design discussions, and make tradeoffs.
  • Work with ML/data teams to operationalize models (data pipelines, feature stores, inference latency, model monitoring).
  • Coordinate hardware integration efforts (DAS/DTS devices, edge compute).

3. Stakeholder & Customer Management

  • Act as the primary technical contact for enterprise customers (oil & gas, utilities), translating customer requirements to the engineering backlog.
  • Prepare and present technical status and risk updates to senior leadership and customers.

4. Quality, Reliability & Field Readiness

  • Define and enforce non-functional requirements: uptime, observability, incident response, and on-field diagnostics.

5. People & Process

  • Mentor engineering teams, run technical interviews, and help grow the engineering team.
  • Improve development processes for faster, safer releases in a hardware-coupled product environment.

Required (Must-Have) Qualifications:

  • Experience: 10+ years total professional experience, with 5+ years in technical/project leadership roles (program/engineering manager, tech lead, etc.).
  • Early Development Background: Strong hands-on development experience earlier in career — Python required, plus proven front-end experience (React/Angular/TypeScript or similar). Must be comfortable jumping into development discussions.
  • Education: B.Tech / B.E. in Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent (strict requirement).
  • Domain Familiarity: Experience with AI/ML product delivery, data engineering, or industrial IoT is strongly preferred.
  • Systems Understanding: Experience with distributed systems, real-time processing, and integrating cloud + edge components (AWS/GCP/Azure).
  • Delivery Skills: Proven Agile / Scrum delivery track record and ability to run complex cross-functional programs.
  • Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication; experience liaising with senior stakeholders and customers.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at athira.haridas@team.tranzmeo.com
summary: Senior Technical Project Manager to lead AI + fibre-optic sensing product programs. Requires 10+ years experience, strong Python/front-end background, and Agile delivery skills.

job_description:
AI & ML Engineer (Senior)

Location: Kochi / Infopark Phase II Campus

Experience & Educational Requirements

  • Experience: Minimum of 7 years relevant experience in AI/ML engineering, data science, or related industry/product-engineering roles.
  • Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or similar. A B.Tech/M.Tech in CSE/IT with a strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, and ML mathematics is highly preferred.
  • Track Record: Demonstrable experience (3-5 years within the 7+) in building and deploying ML models in production environments.
  • Product Focus: Experience in product-oriented work (vs. purely research) is advantageous.

Key Responsibilities

  • Model Development: Lead the design, development, implementation, and optimization of machine learning, deep learning, and anomaly-detection models for Tranzmeo's flagship product and other AI solutions.
  • End-to-End Workflow: Manage the entire ML lifecycle, including data ingestion, cleaning, feature engineering, model training, evaluation, deployment (edge/cloud/hybrid), and monitoring.
  • Collaboration (Hardware/Edge): Work closely with hardware and edge teams to integrate signal/sensor data pipelines (e.g., fiber-optic sensing, DAS/DTS) for real-time anomaly detection.
  • Scalable Architectures: Build scalable architectures for AI/ML workflows, handling large volumes of streaming data, distributed processing, and potential edge-computing constraints.
  • Mentorship & Best Practices: Mentor junior ML/data engineers, conduct code reviews, establish best practices, and enforce engineering discipline (unit-testable code, model versioning, reproducibility).
  • Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with product management, domain experts (oil & gas/infrastructure), and field engineers to translate business problems into ML solutions and iterate on model outcomes.
  • Innovation: Stay updated on the latest advancements in ML/AI (anomaly detection, streaming analytics, sensor-signal processing, edge ML) and drive innovation within the company's tech stack.
  • Technical Architecture: Contribute to technical architecture decisions, selecting appropriate frameworks, libraries, and tools (e.g., Python ecosystem, TensorFlow/PyTorch, streaming frameworks, cloud/edge deployment).
  • Performance Monitoring: Measure model performance in production, define KPIs (detection/false-alarm rates), track model drift, and manage retraining/refinement processes.
  • Documentation & IP: Document designs, maintain version control, ensure experiment reproducibility, manage model lifecycle, and potentially contribute to patents or publications.

Required Technical Skills

  • Programming: Excellent proficiency in Python (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn) and strong software engineering fundamentals (algorithmic thinking, data structures, Git, code reviews).
  • ML/AI Expertise: Deep experience in supervised, unsupervised, anomaly detection, time-series, streaming data, and deep learning (CNNs, RNNs/LSTM, transformers).
  • Data Pipelines: Experience with sensor data, large-scale data ingestion/processing pipelines, and streaming analytics (Kafka, Spark Streaming, Flink) is a plus.
  • Deployment: Knowledge of deploying ML models in cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) or edge/hybrid environments, including model serving frameworks and monitoring tools.
  • Domain Knowledge: Familiarity with IoT/industrial data domains (e.g., pipelines, remote sensing, fiber-optic sensors) is highly desirable.
  • Mathematics & Statistics: Strong background in probability, linear algebra, optimization, hypothesis testing, and performance metrics (ROC/AUC).
  • Code Quality: Ability to write clean, maintainable engineering code and collaborate effectively with software/embedded teams.
  • Communication: Good communication skills for explaining model outcomes to non-ML stakeholders.

Desired Additional Skills / Attributes

  • Experience with specific anomaly detection frameworks for industrial systems, remote sensing, or intrusion detection.
  • Experience with big data technologies (Hadoop/Spark, NoSQL, time-series databases) and large datasets.
  • Familiarity with edge computing constraints (model size, latency, hardware sensors, embedded systems).
  • Intellectual curiosity, startup mindset, comfortable with ambiguity, and taking initiative.
  • Leadership and mentoring abilities.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to rapidly acquire domain knowledge.
  • Focus on production readiness, documentation, and reproducibility.
  • Willingness to travel for field data or model deployment if needed.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at athira.haridas@team.tranzmeo.com
summary: Senior AI/ML Engineer to lead model development for industrial IoT solutions. Requires 7+ years experience in production ML, Python, and scalable architectures.

job_title: Data Migration Expert (Oracle EBS to SAP S/4HANA)
job_description:
Data Migration Expert (Oracle EBS to SAP S/4HANA)

The Data Migration Expert will lead and support the end-to-end migration of data from Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) to SAP S/4HANA as part of a large-scale ERP transformation. This role demands deep technical expertise in ERP data structures, hands-on experience with ETL tools (especially SAP BODS), and the ability to critically evaluate deliverables from SAP and system integrators.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Strategy & Execution: Define and manage data migration scope (master, transactional, historical), contribute to planning and execution, and ensure full traceability from EBS to SAP.
  • Technical Delivery: Utilize SAP BODS and other ETL tools for data extraction, transformation, and loading; perform data profiling, cleansing, and reconciliation.
  • Quality Assurance: Review mapping logic, transformation rules, and load templates; validate test results and cutover readiness.
  • Governance & Compliance: Align migration with data governance, audit, and security standards; maintain documentation and collaborate on sign-offs.
  • Stakeholder Collaboration: Liaise with SAP, business, and technical teams to resolve issues, communicate progress, and ensure a clean, compliant transition.

Required Experience:

  • 7+ years in data migration, preferably Oracle-to-SAP.
  • Proficiency in SAP BODS/Data Services and other ETL tools (e.g., CPI-DS, Informatica, Talend).
  • Strong skills in data quality management, validation, and reconciliation.
  • Excellent analytical and cross-functional communication abilities.

Customer & Stakeholder Communication - Act as a bridge between customers and internal teams, ensuring smooth communication. - Respond to client queries and support issues via email, chat, or support systems. - Maintain and update customer documentation, FAQs, and training materials. - Track, escalate, and follow up on customer requests until resolution. - Assist in creating training documents and user manuals for end-users.

5. Research & Continuous Improvement - Conduct market research and competitor analysis for industry trends and product enhancements. - Stay updated on business analysis methodologies, tools, and frameworks (Agile, Scrum, Lean). - Contribute to the continuous improvement of internal processes and templates.

Preferred Skills

  • Degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field (Recently Graduated).

Brief Description

We are seeking a highly motivated Product Marketing Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for driving go-to-market strategies, crafting compelling product positioning, and executing marketing campaigns that build awareness, generate leads, and support sales growth. You’ll work closely with cross-functional teams, including product, sales, and design, to ensure consistent messaging and a strong market presence.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute product marketing strategies to increase brand visibility and drive customer acquisition.
  • Create engaging content such as blogs, case studies, presentations, email campaigns, and social media posts tailored for different channels and audiences.
  • Plan and manage marketing campaigns across digital platforms like LinkedIn, Pinterest, Meta, Google Ads, SEO, email, and events.
  • Collaborate with the product team to translate technical features into clear customer benefits.
  • Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and positioning strategies.
  • Support sales teams with marketing collateral, product demos, and sales enablement tools.
  • Track and analyze campaign performance, preparing reports with actionable insights.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or related field.

  • Strong understanding of digital marketing tools like Google Analytics, SEO/SEM, LinkedIn Ads, Mailchimp/HubSpot, or similar.
  • Strong SEO knowledge with exposure to the latest trends and best practices.
  • Excellent communication, copywriting, and storytelling skills.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment.
  • Creative mindset with attention to detail and data-driven decision-making.

Nice to Have (Preferred Skills)

  • Familiarity with CRM tools (HubSpot, Salesforce, Zoho).
  • Knowledge of product lifecycle, GTM strategies, and customer journey mapping.

To apply: Interested candidates may send their updated resume to career@ibosoninnov.com to begin the interview process.

job_description:
Solution Architect (Optimizely)

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com Published: 14, Nov 2025 Closing Date: 21, Nov 2025

Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Brief Description

We are looking for 12+ years experienced candidates for this role.

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced Solution Architect to lead the design and implementation of a large-scale migration from SAP B2B to Optimizely Commerce Cloud. This role will serve as the technical leader, responsible for defining a scalable, secure, and future-ready architecture. The ideal candidate has deep expertise in enterprise commerce systems, cloud architecture, and system integrations. You will guide development teams, ensure best practices in solution design, and ultimately take full ownership of the architecture and development transition from the vendor.

Responsibilities include:

Architecture & Design

  • Define the end-to-end migration architecture from SAP B2B to Optimizely, including CMS, Commerce, and PIM integration.
  • Design scalable, secure, and high-performance frameworks aligned with business goals.
  • Establish data migration strategies for products, pricing, and customer hierarchies.
  • Ensure API integration between SAP, Optimizely, and other enterprise systems.

Technical Leadership

  • Lead and mentor development teams on best practices and coding standards.
  • Collaborate with Optimizely consultants and internal teams to validate feasibility and technical approach.
  • Drive DevOps strategy for CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and cloud deployment.

Project Ownership

  • Act as the technical owner of the migration project, taking over from vendor after initial phases.
  • Ensure alignment with enterprise security and compliance standards.
  • Provide technical guidance during feasibility analysis and pilot module migration.

Collaboration & Communication

  • Work closely with Business Analysts to translate requirements into technical solutions.
  • Communicate architecture decisions to stakeholders and leadership in business-friendly terms.
  • Support QA teams with test strategy for performance, integration, and security.

Preferred Skills

Primary Skills:

Technical Expertise

  • SAP B2B Architecture: Deep understanding of SAP Commerce Cloud, Back Office, and integration patterns.
  • B2B Platform: Hands-on experience with CMS and Commerce Cloud platforms, specifically Optimizely.
  • Optimizely PIM & Spire: Strong knowledge of Optimizely Product Information Management (PIM) and Spire framework for modern commerce experiences.
  • .NET Development: Proficient in .NET Core and ASP.NET, essential for Optimizely development.
  • Cloud Architecture: Strong knowledge of Azure PaaS, commonly used for hosting Optimizely solutions.
  • Azure Active Directory: Experience with identity and access management using Azure AD.
  • API Design & Integration: Skilled in RESTful services, SAP APIs, and Optimizely endpoints.
  • Frontend Development: Strong React expertise with CMS integration experience.

Architectural Leadership

  • Modern Architecture Concepts: Experience with monolithic and microservices-based systems.
  • Solution Architecture Design: Ability to design scalable, secure, and maintainable frameworks.
  • System Integration: Expertise in bridging SAP and Optimizely platforms, including middleware and data flow strategies.
  • Performance & Scalability: Planning for optimized performance and future growth.
  • Security & Compliance: Knowledge of enterprise-grade security, data protection, and regulatory standards.

Project Ownership

  • End-to-End Leadership: Proven ability to lead projects from blueprint to execution.
  • Vendor Transition: Skilled in taking over architecture and development from external consultants.
  • Stakeholder Communication: Capable of translating technical decisions into business value for diverse audiences.

Secondary Skills:

Technical Enhancements

  • GraphQL & Headless CMS Architecture: Beneficial for building modern, flexible commerce experiences.
  • DevOps & CI/CD Pipelines: Experience with tools like Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions for automated deployments.
  • Containerization: Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes for scalable and efficient deployments.

Soft Skills:

  • Team Mentoring & Coaching: Experienced in guiding developers through complex migration phases and technical transitions.
  • Agile Methodology: Skilled in managing sprints, backlogs, and iterative delivery cycles to ensure timely and quality outcomes.
  • Analytical Thinking & Problem-Solving: Strong capability in feasibility analysis, module mapping, and resolving architectural challenges.
  • Continuous Learning Mindset: Proactively stays updated with evolving trends in SAP BTP, Optimizely, and cloud technologies.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

Important Notice:

This is to notify jobseekers that some fraudsters are promising jobs with Reflections Info Systems for a fee. Please note that no payment is ever sought for jobs in Reflections. We contact our candidates only through our official website or LinkedIn and all employment related mails are sent through the official HR email id. Please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com for any clarification/ alerts on this subject.
summary: Seeking a Solution Architect for SAP B2B to Optimizely migration. Must have 12+ years of experience in enterprise commerce, cloud architecture, and system integrations.

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com

Job Published: 14, Nov 2025 Closing Date: 21, Nov 2025 Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com

Introduction

We are looking for a Technical Project Manager with 12+ years of experience in migration projects, preferably from SAP Commerce (Hybris) to Optimizely Commerce Cloud. The Technical PM will be responsible for end-to-end delivery oversight, including team onboarding, vendor knowledge transition, governance, SLA adherence, and quality assurance. This role requires strong B2B domain knowledge, hands-on technical understanding, and leadership skills to ensure successful migration and long-term ownership of the solution.

Responsibilities:

Project Planning & Delivery - Define and manage the migration roadmap, timelines, and milestones. - Oversee end-to-end delivery ensuring SLA compliance, quality, and governance. - Conduct feasibility analysis and risk assessments for migration phases.

Team & Vendor Management - Lead team onboarding and ensure smooth transition of knowledge from vendors. - Act as the primary liaison between internal teams, vendors, and stakeholders. - Drive vendor handover strategy for architecture and development ownership.

Technical Oversight - Ensure alignment with solution architecture and technical standards. - Collaborate with architects and developers to resolve technical challenges. - Monitor integration, data migration, and performance testing activities.

Governance & Reporting - Maintain project documentation, dashboards, and progress reports. - Conduct status meetings and communicate updates to leadership. - Ensure compliance with security, quality, and enterprise standards.

Preferred Skills:

Primary Skills: - Experience in migration projects – ideally SAP Hybris to Optimizely - Strong B2B domain knowledge – pricing, catalogs, workflows, customer hierarchies. - Hands-on technical understanding – .NET Core, APIs, CMS/Commerce Cloud concepts. - Proficiency in Agile project management – sprint planning, backlog management. - Excellent stakeholder communication and vendor management skills. - Strong governance and SLA management experience.

Secondary Skills: - Direct experience with Optimizely Commerce Cloud and Spire framework. - Experience with JS framework (React/Angular/VueJS) & CMS proficiency. - Familiarity with SAP Commerce Cloud (Hybris) architecture. - Knowledge of Azure cloud services and CI/CD pipelines. - Exposure to data migration strategies and performance optimization. - Certification in PMP or Agile/Scrum methodologies.

Soft Skills: - Leadership & Team Management - Communication Skills - Problem-Solving & Decision-Making - Negotiation & Influencing - Adaptability - Conflict Resolution - Time Management & Prioritization

Application Instructions: Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

Important Notice: This is to notify job seekers that some fraudsters are promising jobs with Reflections Info Systems for a fee. Please note that no payment is ever sought for jobs in Reflections. We contact our candidates only through our official website or LinkedIn and all employment related mails are sent through the official HR email id. Please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com for any clarification/ alerts on this subject.
summary: Seeking a Technical Project Manager with 12+ years of experience in migration projects, preferably SAP Hybris to Optimizely. Role involves end-to-end delivery oversight, team/vendor management, and technical guidance for successful migration.

job_description:
Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) - .NET

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India, 695581 Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com Job Published: 14, Nov 2025 Closing Date: 21, Nov 2025

Introduction

Reflections Info Systems is seeking candidates with 3+ years of experience for the role of Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET). This position is crucial for ensuring the quality and reliability of our SAP B2B to Optimizely Commerce Cloud migration.

Job Description

The SDET will leverage strong programming and QA expertise to design, develop, and execute both automated and manual tests. The role involves validating functional workflows, API integrations, and data accuracy. Key responsibilities include building automation frameworks, integrating tests into CI/CD pipelines, and collaborating with development and business teams to deliver a robust and scalable solution.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain automated test suites using .NET Core/C#, Selenium, or Playwright.
  • Perform API testing for ECC-Optimizely integrations using Postman or RestSharp.
  • Validate migrated data using SQL queries and backend checks.
  • Implement unit and integration tests with xUnit, NUnit, or MSTest.
  • Set up and manage test pipelines in Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions.
  • Conduct functional, regression, and end-to-end testing for ecommerce workflows.
  • Perform performance testing using JMeter, k6, or similar tools.
  • Ensure secure API practices and basic security testing (OWASP awareness).
  • Collaborate in Agile teams, participate in sprint planning, and report defects in JIRA or Azure Boards.
  • Generate test reports using ExtentReports, Allure, or custom dashboards.

Preferred Skills:

Primary Skills: - Technical Testing: - .NET Core / C#: Strong programming skills for writing automated tests and test utilities. - API Testing: Experience with tools like Postman, RestSharp, or Swagger for testing ECC-Optimizely integrations. - Unit Testing Frameworks: Proficiency in xUnit, NUnit, or MSTest. - Test Automation: Building and maintaining automation suites using Selenium WebDriver or Playwright (for UI testing). - SQL & Data Validation: Writing queries to validate migrated data between ECC and Optimizely. - CI/CD Integration: Setting up test pipelines in Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, or Jenkins. - Functional & Integration Testing: - End-to-End Test Scenarios: Covering product catalog, pricing, inventory, and order workflows. - Regression Testing: Ensuring stability after each migration phase. - Error Handling & Logging: Implementing robust logging and exception tracking. - Quality Practices: - Test Strategy & Planning: Creating test plans aligned with migration phases. - Defect Management: Using tools like JIRA, Azure Boards, or TestRail. - Version Control: Git for managing test code and collaboration.

Secondary Skills: - Performance & Security Testing: - Load Testing Tools: JMeter, k6, or Locust for performance validation. - Security Testing Basics: Awareness of OWASP Top 10 and secure API practices. - SAP ECC Awareness: - Basic ABAP Understanding: To interpret ECC logic and validate data extraction. - ECC Data Models: Familiarity with tables like MARA, KNA1, VBAK for test data setup. - Optimizely Platform Familiarity: - Optimizely Commerce Workflows: Understanding how catalog and order flows work. - CMS Testing: Validating content rendering and personalization logic. - Collaboration & DevOps: - Test Reporting Tools: Extent Reports, Allure, or custom dashboards. - Agile Methodology: Working in sprints, attending stand-ups, and contributing to retrospectives.

Soft Skills:

  • Strong communication and documentation abilities.
  • Analytical thinking to identify edge cases and potential data issues.
  • Proactive collaboration with developers, business analysts, and stakeholders.

Application Instructions:

Interested candidates are requested to forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com, including their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

Important Notice Regarding Job Offers:

Reflections Info Systems strictly prohibits any form of payment for job opportunities. Be vigilant against individuals fraudulently offering employment with Reflections Info Systems for a fee. All official communication from Reflections Info Systems originates solely through our official website or LinkedIn. Employment-related emails will exclusively be sent from our official HR email address. For any clarifications or alerts regarding this matter, please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com.
summary: Seeking an experienced SDET with .NET skills for a SAP to Optimizely migration. Responsibilities include test automation, API validation, and CI/CD integration.

job_description:
Lead (Full Stack - FE / BE / React)

Company: Reflections Info Systems (P) Ltd Location: 9A2, Carnival Technopark, Kariyavattom P.O, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, India , 695581 Website: http://www.reflectionsglobal.com Contact Email: Careers@reflectionsinfos.com Job Published: 14, Nov 2025 Closing Date: 21, Nov 2025

Brief Description

We are looking for candidates with 8+ years of experience for this role.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled Full Stack Developer to lead the end-to-end migration of our B2B platform to Optimizely. This role demands deep technical expertise across front-end and back-end technologies, strong architectural understanding, and hands-on experience with ecommerce systems. The ideal candidate will drive the technical strategy, implementation, and integration efforts, ensuring a seamless transition from SAP ECC to Optimizely Commerce.

Responsibilities include:

  • Lead the full lifecycle of the B2B to Optimizely migration project, from planning to deployment.
  • Develop scalable, secure, and maintainable full-stack solutions.
  • Collaborate with architects, business analysts, QA, and DevOps teams to ensure alignment and delivery.
  • Design and implement RESTful APIs for seamless integration between SAP ECC and Optimizely.
  • Ensure high performance and responsiveness of applications across browsers and devices.
  • Integrate and optimize PIM (Product Information Management) and Spire systems within the ecommerce ecosystem.
  • Implement CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployment using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions.
  • Maintain documentation and provide technical leadership and mentoring to junior developers.

Preferred Skills

Primary Skills:

Front-End (React): - React.js (Hooks, Context API): Building scalable, component-based UIs. - JavaScript (ES6+) / TypeScript: Strong scripting and typing for maintainable code. - HTML5 / CSS3 / SASS: Responsive design and layout skills. - State Management: Redux or React Query for managing complex state. - API Integration: Consuming RESTful APIs securely and efficiently. - Cross-Browser Compatibility: Ensuring consistent UI behavior across platforms.

Back-End (.NET): - .NET Core / C#: Building scalable services and APIs for Optimizely. - Entity Framework / LINQ: Data access and manipulation. - RESTful API Design: Creating secure, performant endpoints for ECC-Optimizely integration. - Authentication & Authorization: OAuth2, JWT, role-based access control. - Database Design: SQL Server or PostgreSQL schema modeling and optimization.

Architecture & Integration: - Optimizely/EPIServer Platform Knowledge: Deep understanding of CMS and Commerce architecture. - SAP ECC Data Models: Familiarity with MARA, KNA1, VBAK, etc., for integration planning. - Middleware & Integration Patterns: Experience with Azure Logic Apps, MuleSoft, or Boomi. - Microservices Architecture: Designing loosely coupled services for scalability. - CI/CD Pipelines: Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions, or Jenkins for automated deployments. - Spire & PIM Integration: Experience integrating product and pricing data into ecommerce platforms.

Business & Domain Knowledge: - Ecommerce Workflows: Product catalog, pricing, inventory, checkout. - B2B Commerce: Understanding of business customer journeys, bulk ordering, and account-based pricing.

Secondary Skills:

Front-End: - UI Frameworks: Material UI, Tailwind CSS, or Bootstrap. - Performance Optimization: Lazy loading, code splitting, caching strategies. - Accessibility (WCAG): Ensuring inclusive design.

Back-End: - GraphQL: For flexible data querying if used in Optimizely extensions. - Message Queues: RabbitMQ, Azure Service Bus for async processing. - Containerization: Docker, Kubernetes for deployment and scaling.

Integration & DevOps: - Monitoring & Logging: ELK stack, Application Insights, or Prometheus. - Security Best Practices: Data encryption, secure API design, GDPR compliance. - Test Automation Awareness: Understanding of unit, integration, and performance testing.

Business & Domain Knowledge: - SAP ECC Migration Strategy: Understanding of data extraction, transformation, and validation. - Stakeholder Communication: Translating technical decisions into business impact.

Soft Skills:

Leadership & Collaboration: - Solution Design: Translating business requirements into technical architecture. - Code Reviews & Mentorship: Guiding developers and enforcing best practices. - Agile Methodology: Working in sprints, managing backlog, and leading stand-ups.

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resumes to Careers@reflectionsinfos.com along with their notice period, current and expected CTC details.

Important Notice Regarding Job Applications:

Please be advised that some fraudsters may claim to offer employment with Reflections Info Systems for a fee. Reflections Info Systems never requests payment for job opportunities. We communicate with candidates exclusively through our official website or LinkedIn, and all employment-related emails are sent from our official HR email address. For any clarifications or alerts regarding this matter, please contact careers@reflectionsinfos.com.
summary: Lead Full Stack Developer to migrate B2B platform to Optimizely. Requires expertise in React, .NET Core, and Optimizely for end-to-end project leadership.

Experience

2 to 4 years

Work Arrangement

On-site

Employment Type

Full-time

We are looking for an IT System Engineer with 2–4 years of experience in IT infrastructure, Office 365 administration, and system support. The role requires experience with Linux and Windows environments, networking (Fortigate or similar), and cloud server deployments.   • High-level knowledge of Linux administration.
  • Experience with cloud VM management (DigitalOcean, OVH, or equivalent).
  • Familiarity with monitoring tools like Grafana, Zabbix, or similar platforms.
  • Strong troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Excellent communication and documentation abilities.
  • Willingness to work in rotational shifts.

Preferred Skills (Good to Have)

  • Exposure to DevOps tools (Docker, Jenkins, Git, CI/CD pipelines).
  • Basic scripting skills in Bash or Python for automation.
  • Experience with infrastructure performance tuning and proactive monitoring.

About Us

Founded over a decade ago with headquarters in the United Kingdom, Lean Transition Solutions Ltd (LTS) is an ISO 9001:2015 certified company advocating Industry 4.0. We deliver Lean Industry 4.0 software solutions and Leadership 4.0 solutions for world-class organizations globally, with offices in India, Germany, Poland, the United States, UAE, Jordan, and Mexico. Our dedicated team ensures client requirements are met and our bespoke software solutions address industrial and manufacturing challenges.

About the Role

We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Marketing Coordinator to support our global marketing and lead-generation activities. The ideal candidate will have strong experience with HubSpot CRM (including automation and AI features) and the ability to coordinate effectively between the UK and India teams. This role is responsible for managing day-to-day marketing operations, coordinating content and campaigns, using automation to increase efficiency, and tracking performance through CRM and analytics tools.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Marketing Coordination - Support the execution of marketing plans and campaigns in collaboration with the global marketing team. - Manage and update marketing collaterals (case studies, one-pagers, capability decks, product sheets). - Coordinate social media posts, email campaigns, and digital content with internal teams. - Maintain and update marketing data, lead sources, and reports in HubSpot CRM. - Liaise with content writers, designers, and video creators to meet campaign deadlines. - Assist in tracking campaign results, lead engagement, and marketing analytics.

2. Marketing Plan Ownership & Team Coordination - Maintain and coordinate the marketing activity plan (daily, weekly, and monthly tasks). - Assign and track deliverables across SEO, content creation, digital design, and social media teams. - Support campaign planning, execution, and follow-up to ensure consistent messaging and output. - Monitor content calendars, posting schedules, and marketing priorities across regions. - Provide weekly updates on progress, blockers, and completed deliverables.

3. Market & Competitor Analysis - Conduct light market research to identify trends, audience shifts, and competitor positioning. - Support benchmarking activities to improve messaging, branding, or campaign direction. - Feed insights into campaign strategy, product positioning, and content relevance. - Track changes in digital engagement, industry events, or sector-specific opportunities.

4. Performance Tracking & CRM Reporting - Measure and report marketing KPIs such as: - Lead generation (Marketing Leads vs Sales Qualified Leads) - Campaign engagement (clicks, impressions, downloads, form fills) - Traffic sources (email, LinkedIn, website, referrals) - Track conversions and attribution using HubSpot CRM. - Share weekly or monthly dashboards with Sales and Leadership. - Optimize campaigns based on data insights and performance metrics.

5. AI & Automation - Use HubSpot workflows, sequences, and AI tools to automate campaign tasks. - Leverage tools like ChatGPT, Canva AI, Grammarly, Jasper, etc. for content support. - Improve efficiency in reporting, document creation, and CRM updates. - Support email automation, segmentation, and follow-up sequences.

Preferred Skills:

Required: - Proficiency with HubSpot CRM (marketing tools, automation, workflows). - Experience with digital content coordination and campaign execution. - Strong organizational and communication skills. - Ability to manage multiple stakeholders and deliverables. - Canva, Google Workspace, MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Docs). - Good Command in English (both verbal and written). - 2–4 years in marketing coordination, campaign support, or CRM-based marketing.

Bonus / Preferred: - Knowledge of CMS, marketing automation tools, or social publishing tools. - Experience with AI content tools (ChatGPT, Jasper, Canva AI, Grammarly). - Prior experience supporting UK/Europe teams. - Bachelor's degree in marketing, Business, Communications, or equivalent.

How to Apply:

Interested candidates may forward their detailed resume to careers@ltslean.com with the subject line “Marketing Coordinator” and include the following information in the email content: - Current CTC: - Expected CTC: - Notice Period: - Current Location: - Total Relevant Experience: - Willingness to work at office:

Contact Email: careers@ltslean.com Website: http://www.LeanTransitionSolutions.com

Role Overview

The Data Analyst will be responsible for analysing large datasets related to underwriting, claims, bordereaux, and financial performance, providing actionable insights to management, underwriting teams, and capacity providers. The role requires strong analytical acumen, attention to detail, and an understanding of insurance/reinsurance data flows, including exposure modelling, premium tracking, and loss ratios.

Key Responsibilities

  • Collect, clean, and validate data from multiple internal and external sources including underwriting systems, bordereaux submissions, reinsurer reports, and claims databases.
  • Develop and maintain automated dashboards and performance reports (e.g., premium income, claims ratio, renewal trends, retention metrics).
  • Perform portfolio and treaty-level analysis to identify patterns, profitability drivers, and underwriting performance by class of business.
  • Support reinsurance data submissions, risk aggregation, and exposure modelling to ensure accuracy and timeliness.
  • Work with the Finance and Underwriting teams to reconcile financial and operational data, ensuring consistency across systems.
  • Assist in quarterly MI packs, regulatory submissions, and broker or capacity provider reporting.
  • Analyse cost per lead, conversion ratios, and other distribution metrics for the MGA’s retail and commercial lines.
  • Collaborate with IT to optimise data pipelines and improve reporting automation.
  • Present findings and recommendations to senior management and board-level committees in a concise, insight-driven format.

Key Skills & Competencies

  • Strong analytical, numerical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficiency in SQL, Power BI / Tableau, and Excel (advanced).
  • Working knowledge of Python or R for statistical modelling or automation (preferred).
  • Understanding of insurance concepts — premium, claims, loss ratio, exposure, treaty vs. facultative, etc.
  • Familiarity with bordereaux management, regulatory reporting (FCA, Lloyd’s, or PRA) and reinsurance data structures.
  • Excellent attention to detail with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.
  • Strong communication skills — able to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.

Qualifications & Experience

  • Degree in Data Science, Statistics, Finance, Actuarial Science, or a related field.
  • Minimum 2–4 years of experience as a Data Analyst in insurance, reinsurance, or MGA sectors.
  • Experience with data visualisation tools and ETL processes.
  • Familiarity with regulatory or Lloyd’s MI reporting is a plus.
